requirements.description:
This work package will augment an existing dynamic team developing and delivering software capability demonstrators for Defence clients using the Resilient Decision Highway (RDH) infrastructure. It will focus on extending the existing capabilities to include open source information, engaging with potential partners and users and enabling their adoption of RDH, and working with key Defence Integrated Investment Projects to understand and support their requirements.

Defence Science & Technology Group (DSTG), seeks to engage experienced sellers who have capability to provide:

1.    Software developers (x2): Open Source integration team, to support rapid prototyping and integration of open source information and other ‘human domain’ capabilities onto the Resilient Decision Highway for inclusion in the concept demonstrator.

2.    Technical writers (x2): to support drafting of system and design documentation for the Resilient Decision Highway, to assist with on-boarding new developers and for supporting translation of prototypes into clients within the key internal stakeholder group.

3.    Technical Program Manager (x1): to assist with stakeholder engagement into Defence projects for which the key internal stakeholder group is responsible, and to support drafting of related project documentation for including Technology Risk Assessments, and Science and Technology plans, following defined standards.

data.label: Working arrangements
data.value: Full time roles based at DSTG Edinburgh, SA.

essential.desc: Software Developers: • University level qualification in Computer Science or Software Engineering, or a similar degree majoring in either of these two disciplines. • Competency in modern programming languages and configuration models, i.e., Spring • Algorithm implementation and optimisation. • A motivated, team player with a willingness to take on new challenges. • The ability to undertake research under guidance.

Technical Writers & Technical Program Manager: • Ability to read and understand complex software documentation and Defence project documentation • Ability to summarise key features of such documentation at levels appropriate for different users, such as managers, scientists and ADF users • High level writing skills • High level interpersonal communication skills

desirable.desc: Software Developers: • Understanding of modern technology and deployment stacks (Containerisation, Micro services, Bus technologies, Integration technologies, DevSecOps & MLOps) • Experience with data science, data analytics and/or knowledge representation frameworks • Software configuration management and documentation, e.g., Atlassian, GitLab • Web interface design and implementation, e.g., AngularJS, Typescript • Linux and Windows familiarity

Technical Writers & Technical Program Manager: • Expertise or experience in computer science and/or systems engineering • Expertise or experience with ICT projects • Expertise or experience with Defence projects

requirements.description:
Supplier to provide assistance with the implementation of a SAS Viya 4 solution for the Data Systems Modernisation Project. As part of the Data Systems Modernisation Project, supplier will conduct an Architectural review of how SAS is used by Treasury, install and configure Viya 4 on Treasury’s Azure tenancy, and assist in the adoption of the modernised SAS Viya 4 platform. Supplier to support business process improvement to ensure effective and efficient use of the SAS Viya 4 platform. 

Supplier will provide: 

  • Detailed Architecture Design (DAD) document for the installation of the Software in the Environments.
  • Installation, configuration and validation of the Software in the Environments based on the DAD produced and in compliance with the Software Licence Agreement.
  • Planning and/or executing a content migration from SAS 9.4 to Viya 4.
  • Documentation:
    • Installation & Configuration Report which includes links to the Software product documentation.
    • Software Validation Reports for each Environment.
  • Handover and knowledge transfer to Customer's platform and server administrators.


Treasury is also seeking a time and materials approach for future SAS deliverables. We require a range of experienced senior SAS technical resources which may include the following.

  • Architect
  • Installation Consultant
  • Technical Consultant
  • Systems Administrator

requirements.description:
DEWR is leading the development of a new vocational education and training (VET) data collection and reporting system. The VDS program will transform the national VET data system to increase the timeliness and quality of data collection and use. DEWR is working with partner state and territory governments and the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER) to deliver this initiative through several strands of work over the next few years. We are looking for an experienced Technical Writer to assist with producing the required technical, system, testing, reporting, and training documentation; to quality review such documentation from our system build vendor; and to assist with the preparation of the necessary technical, administrative and approval artefacts for service and system procurement. This role is for an IT practitioner with practical experience, who can interpret technical solutions into technical and business documentation.

Key responsibilities (not limited):

• Review and correct system, process and training documentation from our system build vendor

• Produce and review the required technical, system, testing, reporting and training documentation

• Production and review of high level and detailed design and requirements specifications, with input from subject matter specialists

• Production and review of QA documentation - software test plans and reports, defect reports

• Development of continuous integration and continuous deployment processes to meet change management requirements

• Production and review of project artefacts including project plans, and documentation appropriate to the project management and software development methodologies (Waterfall, Agile sprints)

• Production and review of user documentation - instructional and technical manuals, assessments, installation guides, user manuals and training guides

• Production and review of system documentation – product and process documentation appropriate to the software development lifecycle (SDLC), including architecture specifications, process flows, user interface descriptions, glossaries, dictionaries, for BAU support

• Contribute to system architecture design and analysis activities

 • Assist with procurement processes and produce necessary technical, administrative and approval artefacts

**Please note we have included a new submission guide which must be completed and attached to your submission. Failure to complete this guide will result in disqualifying your submission**

requirements.description:
GA has signed a three-year contract with Cirrus to provide ICT Managed Services across infrastructure, desktop, applications, and cyber. This contract was signed in March 2021 with an option to extend in March 2024. 

Prior to deciding on the contract extension, GA wants to perform a review of the contract and understand if the agreement has achieved value for money. This review needs to understand the contract agreement, the metrics agreed by each party and how well service provider has met this agreement.  

In addition, GA would like to understand how well the contracted services align to the current state and priorities of the organisation. The 2023-26 Digital Strategy is under development and this contract will be a key enabler in the achievement of organisational objectives. Identifying opportunities where the contract could be amended to meet the planned objectives of this strategy will help maintain value for money into the future and reduce the need for additional contracts or costly contract variations. 

The outcomes of this review will help inform the extension decision, and identify amendments, if any should be made to the contract.

requirements.description:
Seeking a suitable candidate for the role of Business Analyst:

Project leadership:

  • Lead analysis of a fit for purpose software solution, for integration into existing network and security infrastructure, and build a plan for procurement.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders within the Agency and department, and external software vendors, to gain a detailed understanding of user, technical and security requirements.
  • Represent the interests of the Agency as a member of a multi-disciplinary team, act as champion for the solution and lead the project to successfully onboard the software.
  • Facilitate workshops, including those to identify business needs, monitor and collate data and identify competing demands.
  • Identify, elicit and verify business needs, and interpret technical requirements, to inform effective decision-making and meet the key objectives of the project.

Software implementation:

  • Assess the chosen software solution in consideration of departmental ICT architecture, security, product strategy and program commitments.
  • Ensure all stakeholders, including the multi-disciplinary delivery team, have understood the Agency's requirements and work effectively towards achieving agreed objectives.
  • Understand and anticipate user needs and actively liaise with subject matter experts to ensure user needs are represented in the implemented solution and prioritised backlog.
  • Capture, analyse and deconflict user, technical and security requirements and clearly define deliverables in line with the project schedule.
  • Plan the operational implementation of the solution and change management to ensure the value of the software is maximised.

Successful delivery:

  • Act as the primary contact between the multi-disciplinary delivery team, external software vendors and users, describing the vision and objectives for the project.
  • Inform project decisions, collaborating closely with the Product Owner to accept or reject work based on the delivery of expected outcomes.
  • Manage feedback to guide technical integration and lead any remediation activities required to keep the project on track.
  • Achieve agreement and the formal sign-off of requirements by stakeholders within the Agency and department, and external vendors, and governance groups as required.
  • Collaborate closely with the Enterprise Architecture, Cyber Security and vendor teams, leading necessary adaptations to deliver successful outcomes.
  • Construct documentation to support the requirements definition.

The Malaysian GHG-IMS project will be delivered between the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) and Malaysia’s Kementerian Alam Sekitar dan Air – Environment and Water Ministry (KASA), under the Australia-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.


The project builds on Australia’s more than 20 years’ experience and expertise in national greenhouse gas inventories, and more recently, Australia’s successful collaboration with Thailand in jointly designing and building the Thai inventory IT system known as TGEIS.


The project will build a bespoke inventory management system that enhances Malaysia’s capacity in fulfilling its national reporting obligations under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and Paris Agreement, as well as support Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) implementation.


The Seller will participate in the custom build-out of the GHG-IMS Generic Framework Template to suit Malaysia’s need, support peer-to-peer learning and collaboration activities between Australian and Malaysian officials, and if required, assist Malaysia in procuring the necessary software and cloud-based server licencing.

requirements.description:
The request seeks to engage an experienced service provider who has the capability to provide:

Introduction

The Department of Defence with an enterprise-wide video based/digital online learning platform.

The video based/digital online learning platform needs to help all staff gain new skills and advance their professional careers. The aim is to provide just-in-time learning that features instructional content relevant to employee’s professional and personal interests and goals. Requirement

The enterprise wide video based/digital online learning platform for whole of Defence will:

  1. Provide unlimited access for users covering a wide range of topics such as leadership, business, creative skills and technology.
  2. Offer personalised recommendations and explore the most in-demand skills/reward based on each personal experience.
  3. Provide learning content by industry expert instructors, learn from industry leaders and provide a hands on approach to learning.
  4. Provide access to courses anywhere anytime as a convenient approach to learning, accessible from any desktop or mobile device.
  5. Offer self-paced learning with bite sized video content.
  6. Provide additional resources for each topic to reinforce new knowledge with quizzes and exercise files with the reward of certifications on completion of course.
  7. As required the seller (and online learning platform) will provide customised playlists on specific subject matters as requested by Defence.
  8. Provide function/service where individual Defence learners can download their learning history from the online platform and mobile application.

requirements.description:
Attorney-General's Department requires an experienced Organisational Change Manager

The Organisational Change Manager will work closely with the Program Manager to manage the business and APS change activities to ensure effective delivery of the business and APS capability and enable optimal realisation of desired, measurable benefits.


The Organisational Change Manager will apply comprehensive knowledge of principles, practices and theories as they relate to effective project and change management, with particular regard to PRINCE2, Agile and PROSCI methodologies.


The Organisational Change Manager will develop Change Management Plans and relevant change artefacts to ensure the best outcomes for the relevant stakeholders; covering holistic approach and using five change management levers to drive successful change i.e. communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan and resistance management plan.


The Organisational Change manager will lead, manage and develop the strategy, implementation and evaluation of the project’s benefit management plan and roadmap to ensure that the benefits are agreed with the Benefit Owner, and their realisation is monitored progress against the milestones

As part of this role the successful candidate will be required to deliver the following:

  • Develop and deliver a Change management strategy and plan for the project.
  • Develop and deliver a communication management strategy and plan for the project.
  • Work as a member of project team to execute the agreed plan across all project stakeholders, where the plan will include (but is not limited to):
    • communications for the projects,
    • stakeholder management,
    • user engagement and participation.
    • implementation of the future system,
    • user training,
    • support,
    • business process improvement.
  • Develop and deliver a change management plan structure and approach (including templates) that will assist stakeholders to subsequently develop their own internal change management plans for the project outputs. This plan will require clear role and responsibilities definition between the stakeholders and the project(s).
  • Provide weekly reports to the nominated manager / executive.
  • Report to and attend project meetings as required including project boards or user advisory groups.

requirements.description:
With the establishment of the new NIAA External Communications team, we seek to engage a creative user research/digital design supplier(s) to work closely with the NIAA Project Manager and the Working Group to redevelop two existing NIAA websites www.niaa.gov.au and www.indigenous.gov.au and review the NIAA Intranet. It is expected the supplier(s) will follow the Digital Service Standard when undertaking the design and development of enhanced NIAA website(s).

The requirements are to:

  • review the current state of NIAA websites, current web service processes and existing content management systems
  • gather user insights for a NIAA Website Review and Insights Report to inform the NIAA Website Redevelopment Design; presentation of the Report and workshop of the Website Redevelopment Design
  • gather user insights for a NIAA Intranet Insights Report to inform a NIAA Intranet Design Concept and presentation of the Insight Report and Intranet Design Concept 
  • produce a Web and Content Management Framework
  • implement the Redevelopment Design for websites niaa.gov.au and www.indigenous.gov.au
  • produce training guide for the delivery of web services

To meet the requirements, it is proposed the scope of works will be delivered in two-phases as set out in the attached Scope of Works document.

Phase One: Review and User Insights – NIAA Websites and Intranet, Website Redevelopment and Intranet Design Concept and Web and Content Management Framework.

Phase Two: Redevelopment of www.niaa.gov.au and www.indigenous.gov.au and Web Training Guide.

You can respond to this ATM for the delivery of:

  • both scope of works; Phases One and Two, OR
  • scope of works for Phase One only OR
  • scope of works for Phase Two only
